content.question: From 2010 through 2017 there was a large increase in the number of migrants from Africa to Europe. Which of the following explains a possible impact on the emigrant countries of origin during and after that time period?

choices.label: Increasing emigration resulted in the governments of the countries of origin providing financial support for emigrants.
As more emigrants sent money home, the influx of money created an economic boom in the countries of origin.
Increasing emigration resulted in a decreased need for language training programs in schools to help emigrants find work.
Many emigrants became unemployed, which decreased the total financial contributions to countries of origin.
Remittances increased diffusion of cultural traits such as customs, religion, and food products from the host countries to the countries of origin.

content.answer: As more emigrants sent money home, the influx of money created an economic boom in the countries of origin.
